image.altText: A house is seen surrounded by flood waters

props.synopsis: A report from IAG and a scientific research centre finds escalating risk from severe weather events in south-east Queensland, New South Wales, and south-west Western Australia.

title.children: Insurer calls for climate action as severe weather drives premiums up

image.altText: A man smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has thrust the Democrats into the political wilderness but an uprising in the gritty streets of New York may be their future.

title.children: Why a 'radical' Democrat socialist is causing waves in the United States

image.altText: Men in military attire holding shields with a person and a dog appearing behind them

props.synopsis: Israel's top military lawyer is behind bars after leaking a video of shocking alleged abuse of a Palestinian man in a military jail. This is why the case has shaken politics and the military to the core.

title.children: A leaked video showed an alleged abuse. It's sparked a political fight in Israel

image.altText: A dark-haired, middle-aged woman stands in front of a Reserve Bank of Australia backdrop.

props.synopsis: Last week the RBA governor issued a blunt warning on the state of financial markets and as markets continue to shift from traditional valuation methods, plenty of cool heads are getting nervous.

title.children: Why Michele Bullock is relieved she's keeping rates on hold

image.altText: Sophie Tilley with a picture of her children

props.synopsis: Sophie Tilley says she arrived at her son's childcare to be told an "older man in shorts" had already collected him.

title.children: Sophie recounts 'panic' when daycare wrongly gave son to another person

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouetted jetty and calm water.

props.synopsis: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it's either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity in long-term rentals.

title.children: 'The very best place in Australia' is running out of homes

image.altText: Dan Tehan and Angus Taylor

props.synopsis: The Coalition will gather this morning at a joint party room session as the issue of whether to keep or ditch its net zero commitment roils within the party.

title.children: Coalition to meet after Nationals lead charge to dump net zero

image.altText: a house with solar panels on the roof

props.synopsis: Saying there is enough solar power for everyone in the daytime, Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen will direct retailers to provide three hours of free power every day to consumers.

title.children: Energy retailers to be directed to offer free power three hours a day

image.altText: A grainy CCTV image showing someone wearing black walk in a car park

props.synopsis: Police are investigating possible links between a man accused of a mass stabbing on an English train and a series of other incidents.

title.children: UK train stabbing suspect also charged over incident at London Tube station

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: In an email seen by the ABC, a US-based egg bank told IVF clinics it was introducing its new "Client Success Reward Program in Australia".

title.children: Egg bank's proposed 'reward' scheme likened to 'frequent flyers' for IVF clinics

image.altText: Lots of people using umbrellas walking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: The 165th running of the Melbourne Cup is set to be a soggy one, as rain drenches the city ahead of the race that stops a nation.

title.children: Wet, windy and cold as thousands flock to Flemington for the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: A man wearing a black puffer jacket kneels down on sand on a beach looking at a dead sea creature.

props.synopsis: Ambiguous language in draft national environment laws means acting on scientific facts or not will come down to ministerial discretion.

title.children: New environment laws may help or hinder, depending on who you ask

image.altText: A young Sudanese child with a bandage around their head is held by an adult.

props.synopsis: Reports from the Sudanese city of El-Fasher of mass killings, rapes and other violence "may constitute war crimes and crimes against humanity", the International Criminal Court has warned.

title.children: Reports of mass killings, rapes and starvation in Sudan

image.altText: Dust and debris falling on a cherry picker alongside an old brick building.

props.synopsis: One worker has been critically injured and another was trapped for hours after the tower collapsed while undergoing renovations.

title.children: 'Just started erupting': Medieval tower near Colosseum in Rome collapses

image.altText: men at a table.

props.synopsis: A sophisticated Chinese spy ship monitors Australian, Philippines, United States and New Zealand naval forces as they conduct another round of joint exercises in the South China Sea.

title.children: Chinese ship spies on Australia, Philippines and the US

image.altText: Two men holding documents with Chinese and Russian flags behind them.

props.synopsis: As Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin visits the country, Chinese Premier Li Qiang says the two countries "trust each other" and want to deepen their security and economic ties.

title.children: 'Good neighbours': China and Russia talk up trade and security ties

image.altText: Woman with short hair, smiling, standing in front of large blue digital screen.

props.synopsis: Lidia Morawska, an internationally renowned expert in air quality and its impact on human health, has won Australia's most coveted prize for scientific research.

title.children: World expert in air quality and COVID wins Australia's top science prize

image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Conjoined twins are extraordinarily rare, accounting for fewer than every two in 100,000 births.

title.children: PNG conjoined twins should not be separated due to risk of death, hospital says

image.altText: Erin Patterson being led into a prison van

props.synopsis: The triple-murderer lodges documents in Victoria's Court of Appeal requesting an appeal against her convictions.

title.children: Erin Patterson lodges mushroom murder appeal documents

image.altText: A blonde-haired caucasian man wearing a black suit and red tie makes a grumpy expression

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he felt badly for the British royal family after King Charles stripped his brother Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his title as prince amid mounting pressure over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump says pressure over Epstein scandal was 'terrible thing' for UK royals

image.altText: A bathroom with black and white marble throughout with a toilet next to a window with a chandelier over it

props.synopsis: The US president says the new look is more appropriate than the "Art Deco green tile style" from the last renovation in the 1940s.

title.children: Trump renovates White House bathroom with marble and chandelier over toilet

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt holds up a mouse.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO is urging farmers to reduce opportunities for mice breeding this harvest season as the threat of a pest population boom looms.

title.children: Worrying signs another mouse plague could be on the way

image.altText: A large building with a Shein poster hanging from it.

props.synopsis: Shein is due to open its first ever physical store in Paris on Wednesday.

title.children: France threatens to ban Shein if retailer resumes selling 'childlike' sex dolls

image.altText: Two teen boys smiling as they look at their laptops in a library with shelves full of books

props.synopsis: After escaping the Syrian civil war as a young boy, Mazen Al Jahed is one of more than 13,000 South Australian students putting in the final hours of study in preparation for his year 12 exams.

title.children: Young Syrian refugees overcome life challenges to take on year 12 exams

image.altText: housing minister Clare O'Neil speaking at press conference with Prime Minister anthony albanese

props.synopsis: As the government comes under pressure for rising house prices in the first month of its expanded home deposit guarantee, Clare O'Neil welcomes signs of progress on supply.

title.children: O'Neil welcomes housing progress as Liberal vows to ditch 'NIMBY' tag

image.altText: A large, roofed circular stadium near Hobart's CBD, seen from the air.

props.synopsis: After years of talk, the process to decide the fate of the contentious $1.13 billion stadium at Macquarie Point is finally under way. Here's how it will all unfold.

title.children: How the debate over Tasmania's AFL stadium will finally be settled

image.altText: A closer shot of the damaged Leeuwin.

props.synopsis: A lack of effective communication contributed to a collision between the sail training ship Leeuwin II and a container ship in Fremantle Harbour last year that injured two crew members, a new report has found.

title.children: Distracted pilot on phone as huge ship crashed into Fremantle Harbour

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark suit, white blouse and dark glasses leaves court.

props.synopsis: A Perth mother who stabbed her daughter's teenage boyfriend when she found him semi-naked in the family home avoids a prison sentence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed daughter's secret boyfriend avoids jail

image.altText: Esk market stall

props.synopsis: A Queensland small business owner was hospitalised with concussion after she "copped hailstones to the back of the head" at a community market.

title.children: 'Terrifying': Woman concussed after giant hail tore through school fair

image.altText: A woman and a man walk through glass doors, leaving a building

props.synopsis: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had resorted to eating food out of bins at her school, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim resorted to eating from school bins, court told

image.altText: A man in a pink suit stands before a sign reading 'IT ENDS WITH US'

props.synopsis: The actor's lawsuit against his co-star Blake Lively ends after he missed a court deadline on October 17 to file an amended complaint.

title.children: Justin Baldoni loses lawsuit against Blake Lively after missing deadline

image.altText: Security camera footage showing a flash of light from a meteor during the day.

props.synopsis: Victorians living in the state's Gippsland region say they saw a streak of light whizzing through the Sunday afternoon sky and heard a sonic boom, with many wondering if they saw space junk or a meteor.

title.children: 'Highly unusual' suspected meteor event seen across Victorian sky

image.altText: woman waves on zoom call while breastfeeding her baby

props.synopsis: There are many ways to combine breastfeeding and paid work, for example expressing milk, breastfeeding during breaks, or working from home. Knowing your rights can help you feel more confident when negotiating what that looks like.

title.children: Your rights when it comes to breastfeeding and expressing at work

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache

props.synopsis: Thousands of pages of evidence had to be reissued to defence team after it was lost in server crash.

title.children: Pheobe Bishop murder accused's case delayed due to server crash

image.altText: PROXY 1 River Region Early Education

props.synopsis: Daycare droughts are all too common in regional Australia, but in one New South Wales town, the shortage is so acute, the community is cracking.

title.children: 'Families in tears' as daycare drought keeps workers out of jobs
